31. Which diciples were with Jesus during the 
transfiguration? 
A. Peter, James and Andrew 
B. John, James and Philip 
C. Peter, Jmes and John 
D. Andrew, Thomas and John. 
32. Jesus wept over Jerusalem because 
A. the people did not believe in Him 
B. the city did not know the things that made for 
peace 
C. people were buyinh and selling in the temple 
D. the Pharisees and the priests had misled the 
people. 
33. In the Gospel according to Luke, the multitude that 
followed Jesus during the triumphal entry rejoiced and 
praised God with a loud voice because 
A. they realized that Jesus was a prophet from 
Nazareth 
B. of the mighty workds that they had seen done 
by Jesus. 
C. Jesus was for the first time riding on a colt 
D. they believed that Jesus would deliver them 
from the hands of their enemies. 
 
34. Jesus did not appeal to His Father for legions of angels 
to fight for Him because 
A. it was not proper for angels to physically fight 
human beings. 
B. He could, on His own, avoid the cross 
C. He wnted the scriptures to be fulffiled 
D. the disciples were watching and praying. 
 
35. What did Pilate achieve by sending Jesus to Herod? 
A. He escaped the anger of the Jews 
B. Jesus was not killed in his hands 
C. Herod and Pilate became friends 
D. He was able to pacify the Jews. 
 
36. Which of Jesus’ word on the cross led a bystander to 
give him vinegar? 
A. “Father, forgive them; for they know not what 
they do.” 
B. “Father, into thy hands I commit my spirit.” 
C. “My God, my God, why hast thou forsaken 
me” 
D. “It is finished.” 
 
37. When Jesus said that Lazarus would rise again, Marhta 
thought that 
A. Jesus would raise her brother from the dead 
B. her brother would rise again at the last day 
C. Jesus was talking of his own resurrection 
D. He was talking of spiritual resurrection. 
 
38. What kind of a man was elected to replace Judas Iscariot? 
A. A critic of the Jews 
B. A co-witness of the resurrection 
C. An opponent of the religious leaders 
D. A supporter of religious liberty 
 
39. The event of the day of Pentecost was prophsed by 
A. Jonah B.  Joel C.  Jeremiah D. Micah. 
40. Who was the second martyr of the early church 
A. James the brother of John 
B. John the son of Zebedel 
C. James the Lord’s brother 
D. Stephen. 
 
41. The Christian concept of Justification is that 
A. through faith in Jesus the sinner is now 
regarded by God as guiltless 
B. by one’s efforts in keeping the law, man is now 
perfect before God 
C. through his own knowledge, man can now do 
what is pleasing to God 
D. by his natural wisdom, a sinner could be 
reconciled to God. 
 
42. According to Paul, those who rely on the works of the 
law are under a curse since 
A. the law is made for the weak 
B. the law brings about salvation 
C. none can fully keep the law 
D. the works of the law are of the devil. 
 
43. According to the Letter of Paul to the Roman, sin 
reigned in death, while grace reigned through r 
ighteousness to 
A. salvation B. eternal life 
C. eternal peace D. eternal joy. 
 
44. Christians believe that they are children of God because 
A. they keep the laws and covenants of Abraham 
as commanded by God. 
B. they are church goers and benefactors 
C. they are descendants of Abraham Isaac and 
Jacob 
D. through faith, they were baptized into Christ 
and put on Christ. 
 
45. Christians ought to be humble because 
A. the law commanded it abolutely 
B. Jesus Christ demonstrated it 
C. It is a spiritual gift 
D. only the humble will inherit eternal life. 
 
46. According to Paul, spiritual gifts, if properly employed, 
help in 
A. attracting converts 
B. hastening miracles 
C. identifying evil doers 
D. edifying the church. 
 
47. Paul advised Christians in Thessalonica to keep away 
from any brother who is 
A. living in sin 
B. very stingy in giving 
C. living in idleness 
D. not proclaining the gospel.
